value.name: Chicago revises foot chase policy after fatal police shootings of Adam Toledo, Anthony Alvarez
value.description: Chicago police unveiled a new foot chase policy after a pair of high-profile killings by officers in chase drew national attention.

value.name: Chicago police unveil guidelines for foot-chases 2 months after Adam Toledo's death
value.description: The Chicago Police Department this week announced a new policy barring officers from engaging in foot-chases with people suspected of minor offenses or low-level misdemeanors.Why it matters: The revised policy comes in the wake of foot pursuits that resulted in the fatal officer-involved shootings of 13-year-old Adam Toledo and 22-year-old Anthony Alvarez.

value.name: Family to Build a Sanctuary to Honor Adam Toledo
value.description: The family of Adam Toledo, the 13-year-old who was shot and killed by a Chicago police officer, is planning to build a sanctuary in his honor. The family said it wants to build a place in rural Wisconsin,

video.name: Family to Build a Sanctuary to Honor Adam Toledo

value.name: Adam Toledo would be 14 today. In his honor, his family is creating a sanctuary for at-risk youth in the Midwest
value.description: The family of 13-year-old Adam Toledo, who was fatally shot by a Chicago police officer, is creating a sanctuary for at-risk youth in his honor.

value.name: Family Of Adam Toledo Announces Plans For Adam’s Place, A Rural Escape For At-Risk Youth
value.description: CBS 2’s Tara Molina spoke with Adam Toledo's family about a rural retreat that could be a lifeline for other kids like him.

video.name: Family Of Adam Toledo Announces Plans For Adam's Place, A Rural Escape For At-Risk Youth

value.name: Chicago police announce new policy on foot pursuits in wake of fatal shootings of Adam Toledo and Anthony Alvarez
value.description: A temporary version of the policy will go into effect on June 11, but residents and community leaders will have an opportunity to offer feedback before it becomes permanent in September, police Superintendent David Brown said at a Wednesday news conference.

value.name: Adam Toledo's family announces nonprofit on what would have been his 14th birthday

value.name: Family of Adam Toledo creates nonprofit for at-risk youth
value.description: The space is meant to give at-risk youth a place to meet new people, take care of animals and, most importantly, keep kids away from the temptations of the streets.

value.name: Adam Toledo’s Family Launches Nonprofit Farm To Give At-Risk Boys A Safe Haven From The Streets
value.description: The 13-year-old boy was fatally shot by a Chicago police officer in March. Toledo's family debuted Adam's Place on what would've been his 14th birthday.
